title: Europe needs to listen to the unusual suspects - E3G
summary: The article discusses the need for Europe to transition to a prosperous and fair net-zero economy, emphasizing the importance of faster and bolder actions to achieve this goal.
green_innovation: TRUE: The article discusses the transition to a net-zero economy with a focus on clean technology, renewable energy resources, and decarbonization efforts, aligning with the definition of green innovation.
business_innovation: FALSE: The article does not primarily focus on specific products or business processes introduced by a firm; instead, it emphasizes policy changes, clean technology investments, and strategic decisions related to the transition to a net-zero economy.
green_product: FALSE: The article does not focus on the design, production, or use of a specific product that significantly reduces environmental impact throughout its lifecycle.
green_process: TRUE: The article discusses methods and strategies to minimize environmental impacts, promote sustainability, and transition to a cleaner economy, aligning with the definition of green processes.

greenwashing: FALSE: The article does not contain any false or misleading environmental claims about a product or practice; it primarily focuses on the need for policy changes, clean technology investments, and strategic decisions for a net-zero transition.

title: Cosmetic 360: “The green transition is an innovation challenge” - Premium beauty
summary: The Cosmetic 360 show, organized by the Cosmetic Valley, focuses on Cleantech innovations in the cosmetics and perfume industry, featuring sessions on responsible consumption, packaging ecoresponsibility, decarbonation, and circular economy technologies. The event showcases a variety of innovative solutions and environmentally friendly practices, aiming to advance the industry's environmental protection efforts.
green_innovation: TRUE. The article discusses Cleantech innovations such as decarbonation, waste management, circular economy, and biomaterials in the cosmetics and perfume industry, highlighting their contribution to environmental protection and sustainability goals.
business_innovation: TRUE. The article talks about the introduction of new technologies and practices in the cosmetics and perfume industry, including responsible consumption patterns, ecoresponsible packaging, and the adoption of Cleantech solutions, demonstrating significant differences from previous approaches.
green_product: TRUE. The article discusses green products in the cosmetics and perfume industry that aim to reduce environmental impacts throughout their life cycle through the use of sustainable materials, energy-efficient production processes, and functionalities that support recycling and low environmental impact.
green_process: TRUE. The article highlights green processes in the cosmetics and perfume industry that focus on minimizing environmental impacts, reducing waste, conserving resources, and limiting the release of harmful substances, aligning with sustainability objectives.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 325620 - Toilet Preparation Manufacturing, 325620 - Perfume, Cosmetics, and Other Toilet Preparations Manufacturing, 541940 - Veterinary Services, 424210 - Drugs and Druggists' Sundries Merchant Wholesalers
greenwashing: FALSE. The article focuses on genuine efforts and initiatives within the cosmetics and perfume industry to promote environmental sustainability and Cleantech innovations, without deceptive or misleading claims of environmental benefits.

title: Government of Canada announces $9.9 million to scale up B.C. technology businesses and improve productivity - Canada NewsWire
summary: The Integrated Marketplace initiative in British Columbia connects local tech companies with large-scale organizations to pilot green solutions, supported by government funding.
green_innovation: TRUE, The Integrated Marketplace focuses on sustainable solutions that address business challenges and advance climate goals in real-world environments.
business_innovation: TRUE, The introduction of the Integrated Marketplace initiative in British Columbia is a new business process involving multiple technology companies and large-scale organizations to pilot green solutions.
green_product: TRUE, The article mentions the development of new products and services that reduce greenhouse gas emissions and operational impacts at sites like the Port of Vancouver and Vancouver International Airport.
green_process: TRUE, The article highlights the implementation of green technologies and solutions such as electrifying support vehicles and reducing diesel fuel consumption to decarbonize operations at transportation sites in British Columbia.
greenwashing: FALSE, The article does not exhibit greenwashing as it focuses on government funding to support and promote green innovations and sustainability in technology.

title: Elemis partners with Morro to create upcycled single-use sachets for cosmetics - Premium beauty
summary: Elemis collaborates with Morro and Xampla to create bio-based film for plastic-free sachets, aiming to replace single-use plastics in skincare samples through upcycling leftover plant waste. Supported by grants, the initiative addresses challenges in recyclability and sustainability.
green_innovation: TRUE, The collaboration between Elemis, Morro, and Xampla to develop bio-based film for plastic-free sachets aligns with the definition of green innovation by aiming to reduce environmental impact and promote sustainability through upcycling and replacing single-use plastics with plant-based materials.
business_innovation: TRUE, Elemis' initiative to create bio-based film for plastic-free sachets can be considered a business innovation as it involves introducing a new product process combination that significantly differs from the company's previous products and processes, focusing on environmental sustainability goals.
green_product: TRUE, Elemis' development of plastic-free sachets using bio-based film from upcycled plant waste qualifies as a green product as it significantly reduces environmental impact throughout its life cycle by promoting sustainability, conserving natural resources, and minimizing waste and toxic substances.
green_process: TRUE, The process of creating bio-based film for plastic-free sachets through upcycling leftover plant waste and utilizing plant-based materials aligns with the definition of a green process as it aims to minimize environmental impacts, reduce waste, conserve resources, and limit the release of harmful substances.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 325620 - Toilet Preparation Manufacturing, 325998 - All Other Miscellaneous Chemical Product and Preparation Manufacturing, 325411 - Medicinal and Botanical Manufacturing, 325412 - Pharmaceutical Preparation Manufacturing
greenwashing: FALSE, The article does not appear to demonstrate greenwashing as Elemis' initiative with Morro and Xampla aims to genuinely address sustainability challenges in their packaging by leveraging bio-based materials and upcycling plant waste.

title: CICE Funds Innovation to Advance the Measuring, Monitoring, and Verification (MMV) of Carbon Management - Canada NewsWire
summary: The B.C. Centre for Innovation and Clean Energy will provide $2.82 million in funding to support carbon emission reduction, removal, and avoidance projects by local clean energy innovators.
green_innovation: TRUE, The article describes funding for innovative solutions focused on decarbonization and emissions reduction, contributing to environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: FALSE, The article focuses on funding for clean energy solutions rather than new or improved products or business processes.
green_product: FALSE, The article does not specifically mention a green product as defined by reduced environmental impact throughout its life cycle.
green_process: TRUE, The article discusses the development of methods and technologies to assess and reduce carbon emissions, which align with the definition of green processes.
